turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hey, you're good! I bet you could pick up a living at this if you tried.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: And end up a hunchback like my old man? You think I'm crippled? You shoulda caught him the end of a day.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Kee-rist, you pretty damn clever for a skimpy little gimp.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: You like it? Take a look.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Don't rush me. How I do it, see, I get myself primed, like I was turning on the charm for some pretty little blonde lady, then kinda mosey away slow and easy and - swing around! -- and there you are, you handsome devil.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Not bad -- for a cowboy -- you're okay, you're okay.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What I'm gonna do, I'm gonna make a cowboy outta you, kid. How about that? Build you up a little, teach you couple little tricks'n turn y'out to stud, Rat-stuff.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shee-it. Cough yourself inside out, then light a fag, a goddam fag. You make me puke. Where'd you steal it? In the movies?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: The coat? A guy I did a favor once gave it to me. Christ.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Who'd you ever do a favor for? You just let some poor bastard freeze to death, wouldn't you?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Where'd that come from?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Forty-second Street. Where'n hell you think it come from?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: You wanna know the truth? You dumb bastard, I got it for you. Look at it. Goddam thing's ten sizes too big for me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Kee-rist, you sure are one twisty little bastard, Ratso.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: The name's Rico, at my own father's grave, a man deserves some respect.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Respect shee-it! You even steal flowers for his grave.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Can he smell the difference, eh?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, uh, he dam well know he ain't 'be-loved Aunt Winifred'.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: He can't read. Even dumber than you. Couldn't write his own name. X -- that's what it ought to say there on that goddam headstone. One big lousy X like our flat. Condemned. By order of City Hall.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, this thought just struck me. It wasn't too long ago I was washing dishes way the hell somewhere in Texas.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Yeah, well, so?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Now I'm here. I'm in New York City. Getting picked for things. Don't you see what I'm driving at?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: What you're driving at, you want me to get lost so you can go to your fancy-ass party.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Did I say that? Did I?  It don't say nothing about you...

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Don't say nothing about you either.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: But they picked me, right? So what I'll do, I'll just say, now look, you want me? Well, I don't go nowhere without my buddy here.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Well, what the hell, I got nothing better to do.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You got a comb?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Don't need a comb.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Few dozen cooties won't kill me, don't guess.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, I made it. This here is Ratso Rizzo and I...

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Rico. Rico Rizzo.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Tell her, Ratso.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Twenty bucks...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, if you're awright, why you hanging on the bannister. Can you walk or not?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Walk? Naturally I can walk.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: They wrong?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: No. But while you was buying the underwear, I could have lifted the socks.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You couldn't lift fly specks from a sugar bowl. Can you hold this?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: But thanks.  Hey, Joe, don't get sore about this or anything. You promise?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Well, I don't think I can walk.  I mean, I been falling down a lot and, uh...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: And what?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'm scared.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What of?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: What'll happen. I mean what they do to, you know, do with you -- if you can't -- ah, Christ!

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I don't know. Cops. Or the -- how should I know?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Okay. Here it is. You gonna go see the doctor. I got nine bucks and twenty more Thursday and I gonna be riding high before you know it. So you gonna get you the best goddam doctor in this town and get yourself straightened out, that's what.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: No doctors. No, sir. Not me. Doctors are like goddam auto mechanics. Fix one-thing, unplug another. Operate for piles and while they're there, they unscrew your liver. My old man, for God's sake, wasn't any sicker'n I am when he went to the doctor.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, just exactly what the hell you think you're gonna do? Die on me?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'm going to Florida, that's my only chance.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You know what's wrong with you? You got fevers. You kinky as a bedbug. How you gonna get to Florida?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'll find the money. If you just get me on the bus, that's all I ask.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Just when everything's going my way, you gotta pull a stunt like this.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I don't even want you to go. Whaddya think of that? I got other plans for my life than dragging around some dumb cowboy that thinks he's God's gift to women. One twenty-buck trick and he's already the biggest stud in New York City. It's laughable.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: These guys're good drivers.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: They gotta be.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: You get your first palm tree in South Carolina.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: How'n hell a dumb Bronx kid like you know that?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I read it.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shee-it. You believe all you read?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: If you have to shiver, why don't you pull the blanket up more?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I been thinking. I hope we're not gonna have a lotta trouble about my name down there. Because like what's the whole point of this trip anyway?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Keep the goddam blanket on.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I mean New York's one thing, but can you see this guy, imagine it, running around the goddam beach all suntan and he's going in swimming, like, and then somebody yells 'Hey, Ratso' -- how does that sound to you?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Sounds like they knew you.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Sounds like crap, admit it. And I'm not gonna have it. I'm Rico all the time, okay, do you blame me? That's agreed, okay? We're gonna tell all these new people my name's Rico?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hey -- whatsa matter?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'm wet.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You're what?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I wet my pants! My seat's all wet.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Hell, don't cry about it!

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Here I am going to Florida and my leg hurts, my butt hurts, my chest hurts, my face hurts, and like that ain't enough, I gotta pee all over myself.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I'm falling apart, that's funny?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You just -- just -- what happened, you just had a little rest stop wasn't on the schedule.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Hey, what the hell you doing?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm zipping your fly, what the hell you think I'm doing?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Thanks, Joe.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Shee-it, you know, I got this thing all figured out, Ratso. I mean Rico. When we get to Miami, what I'll do, I'll go to work. I gotta do that, 'cause see, I ain't no kind of a hustler. I ain't even any goddam good as a bum. I'm a nothing, that's what I am. So reckon I'd better go to work and get me a goddam job. Okay?

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: A drink? I've got some nice gin. If you'd prefer something else, they'll send it up...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Gin's okay.

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: It's so exciting. New York. The mad forward thrust of everything. My sense of time here is completely altered.

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: Sometimes it seems to me time stopped twenty years ago. There was this war, there was this handsome young man with quite black hair and he was supposed to die. But he didn't. Isn't that amusing?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What d'you want?

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: What you got me up here for?

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: Oh, difficult, it's so difficult. You're a nice person, Joe -- I should never have asked you up -- a lovely person. Oh, how I loathe life. I loathe it. Please go. Please.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You want me to leave?

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: No, yes. No, I mean yes please go. Help me to be good. Come back tomorrow. Promise.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I'm going to Florida.

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: This is terrible. I meet someone who -- then -- wait, I want to give you a present. For your trip. You'll let me please...

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Listen, I gotta have money.

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: Oh. Yes. Of course. I should have thought. You shouldn't have to ask. That was thoughtless of me. Yes. Wait here...

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: Here. Don't even thank me.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: I gotta have more'n ten. I gotta have fifty-seven dollars.

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: I simply don't have it, Joe.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Get outta my way.

turns.speaker: TOWNY
turns.text: You're wasting your time. There's nothing in there.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Am I tickled to find you, boy! Come on in and let's get a look at you. Turn around. Good strong back. You'll need it. So you want help -- take a seat, relax, tell me about yourself. Cowboy, huh?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: No sir, I'm no cowboy really, but I'm a first class stud.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Take it,easy, boy...  Seems to me you're different than a lotta boys that come to me. Most of 'em seem troubled, confused, but I'd say you knew exactly what you want.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: You bet I do, sir.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: But I'll bet you got one thing in common with them other boys. I'll bet you're lonesome.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, not too, I mean, a little.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: I'm lonesome. I'm lonesome so I'm a drunk. I'm lonesome so I'm a dope fiend. I'm lonesome so I'm a thief, a fornicator, a whore-monger. Poop, I say, poop! I've heard it all and I'm sick of it, sick to death.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Yessir, I can see that.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Lonesomeness is something you take. You bear? Dammit, you take it and go about your business, that's all.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Well, uh, I'm raring to go.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Yes, I believe you are. Cowboy, huh?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Uh, yessir.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Ready for hard work, son?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Ready for anything.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: I got a hunch, Joe Buck, it's gonna be easier for you than most.

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Gonna be like money from home.

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Money from home, see, there's your strength, you put things in earthy terms any man can understand, son. I warn you I'm gonna use you, I'm gonna run you ragged!

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: You're a wonderful boy. You'n me gonna have fun, dammit, it don't have to be joyless. Say, why don't we get right down on our knees now?

turns.speaker: JOE
turns.text: Get down -- where?

turns.speaker: O'DANIEL
turns.text: Right here, why not? I prayed in saloons, I prayed in the street, I prayed an the toilet. He don't care where, what He wants is that prayer.

turns.speaker: VETERAN
turns.text: Ever stationed at Kennedy? Those Florida chicks...

turns.speaker: MARINE
turns.text: Instant V-goddam-D.

turns.speaker: VETERAN
turns.text: This Pensacola teeny-bopper -- jail bait -- but built? Ten bucks she wanted. Three of us made a deal for, twenty-five, see, big goddam bargain?

turns.speaker: MARINE
turns.text: Big peni-goddam-cillin bargain, right?

turns.speaker: VETERAN
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: MARINE
turns.text: No. You got it.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: You really want to do business?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Who's he? Oh God! Don't tell me you two are a couple -- ?

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Sold. Let's go.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: ... and taxi fare for me.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: Get lost.

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: I agree. And for that service I charge one dollar taxi fare.

turns.speaker: SHIRLEY
turns.text: He fell. Hey, fella, you fell. Is he all right?

turns.speaker: RATSO
turns.text: Is he all right!

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Getchmis olsun

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Getchmis...?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Olsun - "May it pass quickly." I'm Bell, Jimmy Bell. This is Erich something Swedish.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Looks like a cheap hotel.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Yeah... Only the room service is lousy.  Come on, let me show you the tennis courts.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: 'Figgers.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: ...He had a bald skull and...

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Hamidou.  Chief of the Guards. Don't fuck with him. He almost killed an Italian dude couple months ago.  Bad news. He try anything with you?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: The kids? Why are they...

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Little fuckers are thieves, rapists, pickpockets, murderers, you name it - they do it. Don't trust any of 'em...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: History, man, history. How much?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Two kilos.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: The airport. Trying to get on the plane for the States.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Could be ten or fifteen.  Maybe even twenty.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Twenty months?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Twenty fucking YEARS, man - YEARS! I figger ten at the least.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Years?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Yeah, what do you think this is, the good USA? This is Turkey, man... ) It's a fucking accident here if you're innocent. And anyway... ...ain't nobody who's innocent.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Tunnel?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: It's already built!  There's a basement substructure where they used to keep weapons and stuff, but beneath that there's these old catacombs that the Christians built 'bout a thousand fucking years ago to bury their dead.  We're sitting right on top of it -- here.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Hey!  I'm getting this together man and I don't need no fucking Gastro-head along on this trip!  We go through the wall.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We go through the wall?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: You got that, shit face? Asina...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: KNOCK IT OFF!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's there!

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Listen!

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Want me to take over?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You want to split your hernia again?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How's your hernia?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Don't make me laugh.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Anybody bitten?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Nah, just covered with batshit!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: They went out over there: must be some kind of exit.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Ziat!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: To what?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: The prison, man. There was this German cat an architect in the hospital. He was helping the Turks build some shit round the place. I laid some bread on him and he let me copy them.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Too bad you didn't have a machine.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: There's two ways out I figger - over the roof, but that's only one person, maybe two. The other way is Under.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Gotta be here someplace.  Thought I heard a couple of dead Christians singing down there.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Stop shitting me, man!

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: --the water like "'weeps" through the cement, see. Twenty, thirty years, you can almost push it over. All we do is use Gastrohead's screwdriver here and scrape the mortar out. Pull out 2, 3 stones, squeeze through, put 'em back, and get our ass down the shaft, It's a two night operation, maybe three.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: And what do you do when you in the catacombs?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: The catacoombs?  Whaddya want, a door?  There's miles of em like a sewer system but they got to come up someplace in Istanbul.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Hey, you know what's gonna get us out of here?  It's not a map, Max. It's our balls. You know what I mean...  ...I gotta get laid man, I don't know 'bout you guys, but if I don't get it on soon, I'm... I'm not gonna make it.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Billy?

turns.speaker: BELL
turns.text: Haps, railroad, bus timetables?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Everything.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Dad...I'm...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: ...Don't worry about it.  I can punch you in the nose later. Right now we've got to get you out of here.  You all right?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah. How's Mom?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Bad. She couldn't make the trip. You know Her boy...  Susan told us before we got your letter. She's fine; she's trying to get the money to come back and see you, but...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No, don't let her!  I'll... How about Peg? Robbie?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Same. None of the neighbors know. We told them you were in a hospital in Europe.  Oh... this is Stanley Davis. He's the American Consul here... And Necdit Yesil, the lawyer you wanted...

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Right!  That's what we're shooting for.  Mister Davis and have been in contact with the State Department, but right now relations with the Turks aren't too good, Nixon's upset the hell out of them. Our best bet's... right here.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Dad...  I'll pay you back for all this, I Promise.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Don't worry about it.  Right now money doesn't count. Okay?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Where'd you get that limp?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Nothing. Just twisted my ankle.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where you staying, Dad?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: The Hilton.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How do you like it?  Istanbul?

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Well, it's an interesting place...  Tell you the truth, I think the food is lousy. The crap they sell in these little restaurants. I went out to eat in one of them last night, and I had to run to the damn toilet... You shoulda' seen the toilet.

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Why'd you do it, Billy?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: For the money... )

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: I know you kids smoke that stuff, and we drink booze, but taking it across a border - it was stupid, Billy. Stupid.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: DAD!

turns.speaker: FATHER
turns.text: Oh Jesus!

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: You know where they are?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: How far?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: About ten kilometers.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Sixty Lira?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Sixty?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Those mountains? are they?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Very bad now. Maybe war. Those Greek pigs try to steal Cyprus again ) How'd you lose your friends?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Two miles! Minefields over there. Do you know where this campground is or not?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Not far. Just a little way.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: No!  I'm not going any further! It'll wreck my car.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'll pay extra

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where are the minefields?

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: All over.  Turkish Army up there. It's against the law. They shoot us.  You sure you looking for your friends, man?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Okay!  Ley me out right here.  I'm getting tired of all this bullshit from you.  I'll walk it.

turns.speaker: DRIVER
turns.text: Ah, look!  they probably know where the campers are

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: No, I'm not afraid.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Good. There's nothing to be afraid of. If you co-operate with us, you will be on the plane for New York tomorrow... yes?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yes...?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Good. Now, where did you get the hashish?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: A cabdriver. He picked me up in the Pudding Shoppe in the bazaar.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Would you recognize him again?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yes.  I think so.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE
turns.text: Good.  Would you go back to the Pudding Shoppe now and point him out to my men if you see him?

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: You decided to fly at a bad time Billy Palestinian Guerrillas all over the place blowing up planes and all.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Stupid.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Four planes in four days...but I guess you kids don't read the newspapers...and what with our people kicking up a shit storm 'bout the flow of heroin from Turkey you got...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: But didn't have heroin.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Well, you see Billy, it don't really matter right now if it's 2 kilos or 200 kilos. The Turks love to catch any foreigner smuggling - it shows the world they're fighting the drug trade.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: But just...

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Just what?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I just needed some extra money.  I was broke, the guy offered me the hash and...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: ...are you with the Consulate?

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Something like that. Cigarette?

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: How much you pay this joker... this cab driver?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Two hundred dollars. It was my last two hundred.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: How much did you figure to make?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Three, four thousand...I don't know.  The guy offered me the hash--  ...it just seemed like easy money.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Beats working.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I was just going to sell it to friends.  I'm not a pusher, honest.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Got a family back there?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah. Parents, brother, sister. Babylon, Long Island.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: What's your father do?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He sells insurance for Metropolitan Life.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Be tough on 'em.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Girlfriend?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: ...She was on the plane.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: She didn't know anything about...I wouldn't have wanted her to.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Lucky girl.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Jeez, she used to say I was the lucky one.

turns.speaker: TEX
turns.text: Let's hope so, Billy.  Let's sure hope so.

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: How's it feel?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: About as good as it looks.

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Just Erich.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I'm Billy Hayes... At least I used to be.

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Feeling all right?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah.  That guy who beat me?  I feel stoned.

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: New people sometimes get on his nerves.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What did he do?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: And you?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Hashish.  Ninety percent of the foreigners are in for hashish.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What they give you?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Twelve years.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How much did you have?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: A hundred grams.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: It's not fair!

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: There is no fair in Turkey, Billy. It's all "sula-bula" like this, like that. An Italian hippie had a car accident and a Turk was killed. SO, they threw him in here for six months...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: That doesn't seem so bad.

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: But he was eating lunch a mile away when the Turk smashed into killed himself.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He wasn't even in the car?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Aslan, there...

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: You just got to get yourself a good lawyer.  And some money... Talk to Max.  He's been in the longest.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: ERICH
turns.text: Seven years...

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: Hello, Billy.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: I want you to know we're going to do everything, in our power to get you out as soon as possible. Believe me.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: Sit down a moment, Billy.  I'm afraid I have some bad news for you.

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: No... It looks like your going to have a new court.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: The Prosecutor objected to your sentence for possession; he wanted a smuggling conviction and the High Court in Ankara reviewed it.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: We've been notified that they rejected the sentence...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What do you mean LIFE FOR FOR WHAT! FOR WHAT!

turns.speaker: DAVIS
turns.text: Billy!  Please!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Best way is get your ass out... any... way... you can...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Get the... midnight... express.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: But how would you get into the shaft, Jimmy?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I suppose you knock three times and ask for St. Peter.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: You gotta be fucking crazy!  You got stabbed in the ass once too much, sweetheart, cause you're gonna end up in Section 13, that's what - not the 'catacombs.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Section 13?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah,  for the criminally insane.  I was there once for two weeks and it ain't an illusion. It's awful. Namidou runs it like a death camp, that's where he spends most of his time...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Where is it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I don' t know. It's someplace down in there....  ..deep.. A big door...a wheel....

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You got your stuff?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Okay?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Jimmy?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Two thirty.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Shit!  Shit!  Shit!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: It's a dead end. The Turks musta' sealed it up.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We go back.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What?  You gotta be joking.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: We go back, seal it up again, and come in tomorrow night - every night 'till we get out of here. There's gotta be a way. Those bats got out someplace.  Now let's go.  Doubletime!

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Goddamn Gastro's killing me.  Making me blind. Hey Billy!

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: I got some acid man.  Maybe we can drop some on the guards huh? In their tea or something.

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Yeah I got it all worked out. Billy, listen to me.  That old guard likes you, You drop some acid on him.  When he's Seeing rainbows yer know. walk out - tonight.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Then we're outside the kogus. Then what?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: After we're outside the kogus?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Oh we... we...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Max... Your BILLY shirt's on fire...

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: Cut his fucking throat.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Whose?

turns.speaker: MAX
turns.text: ZIAT... What do I got to lose huh! What do I got to lose. And I'd really enjoy it.
